question.para: What happened with the old append_branch module parameter?
What happened with the old method_filtering module parameter?
What happened with the old sock_flag module parameter?
What happened with the old use_path and path_mode module parameters?
What happened with the old path_use_received module parameter?
What happened with the old nat_flag module parameter?

answer.para: It was removed, as the module internally loads this value from the USRLOC module (see the nat_bflag USRLOC parameter).

question.para: What happened with the old use_domain module parameter?

answer.para: It was removed, as the module internally loads this option from the USRLOC module. This was done in order to simplify the configuration.

question.para: What happened with the old save_noreply and save_memory functions?

answer.para: There functions were merged into the new save(domain,flags) functions. If a reply should be sent or if the DB should be updated also is controlled via the flags.

question.para: Where can I find more about OpenSIPS?
Where can I post a question about this module?

answer.para: First at all check if your question was already answered on one of our mailing lists:
E-mails regarding any stable &osips; release should be sent to &osipsusersmail; and e-mails regarding development versions should be sent to &osipsdevmail;.
If you want to keep the mail private, send it to &osipshelpmail;.

question.para: How can I report a bug?

answer.para: Please follow the guidelines provided at: &osipsbugslink;.

question.para: What happened to the desc_time_order parameter?

answer.para: It was removed, as its functionality was mmigrate into usrloc module, were there is a parameter with the same name.
